dt: {bc}marked by intensity or volume of sound
{bc}obtrusive or offensive in appearance or smell {bc}{sx|obnoxious||}

pt: {sc}loud{/sc} {sc}stentorian{/sc} {sc}earsplitting{/sc} {sc}raucous{/sc} {sc}strident{/sc} mean marked by intensity or volume of sound. {sc}loud{/sc} applies to any volume above normal and may suggest undue vehemence or obtrusiveness.
{sc}earsplitting{/sc} implies loudness that is physically discomforting.
{sc}raucous{/sc} implies a loud harsh grating tone, especially of voice, and may suggest rowdiness.
{sc}strident{/sc} implies a rasping discordant but insistent quality, especially of voice.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}hlūd{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}hlūt{/it} loud, Latin in{it}clutus{/it} famous, Greek {it}klytos{/it}, Sanskrit {it}śṛṇoti{/it} he hears
shortdef: marked by intensity or volume of sound
